# WhatsApp
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/WhatsApp_icon.png/479px-WhatsApp_icon.png)

---

# Who made WhatsApp?
WhatsApp was founded by Brian Acton and Jan Koum in 2009.

![](https://insightssuccess.in/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/Jan-Koum-and-Brian-Acton1.jpg) 

---

## Which company is WhatsApp under now?

In 2014, Facebook acquired WhatsApp for $19 billion, and is now operated under the umbrella of Facebook.

![bg left](https://static1.xdaimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/sobre-aceitar-pagamentos-no-app-whatsapp-business-1-34-screenshot.png)

---

# Why do I like WhatsApp?

The reason why I like WhatsApp is because of how userfriendly it is. It also comes with several features, such as video call, and live location sharing. You can also use WhatsApp on multiple devices.

![bg right](https://www.smartprix.com/bytes/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/WhatsApp-about.png)

---

# How much does WhatsApp cost?

It is completely free to download WhatsApp, and it is available on both Apple app store and Google Play store!

![](https://image.shutterstock.com/image-photo/image-260nw-2293917457.jpg)

---

# Location of the main office

The main office is located in Menlo Park, California, USA, which is also the headquater of Facebook.

![](https://petapixel.com/assets/uploads/2022/02/Meta-May-Shut-Down-Facebook-and-Instagram-in-Europe-800x420.jpg)

---

# Who are their main competitors?

* Telegram
* Signal
* WeChat
![bg right 60%](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Telegram_2019_Logo.svg/800px-Telegram_2019_Logo.svg.png)
![bg right 60%](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8d/Signal-Logo.svg/1200px-Signal-Logo.svg.png)
![bg right 60%](data:image/png;base64,)

---

# 3 cool facts about WhatsApp

* WhatsApp was the first app to reach 1 billion downloads on Android devices.

* WhatsApp processes about 100 billion messages every day.

* WhatsApp co-founder, Brian Acton, applied for a job at Facebook in 2009 but got rejected. He then went on to create WhatsApp, which was later acquired by Facebook for $19 billion in 2014.
